title: Andrew the Apostle
summary: Andrew the Apostle (Greek: Ἀνδρέας Andreas; Aramaic: ܐܢܕܪܐܘܣ[4]), also called Saint Andrew, was an apostle of Jesus according to the New Testament. He is the brother of Saint Peter.[5] He is referred to in the Orthodox tradition as the First-Called (Greek: Πρωτόκλητος, Prōtoklētos).
